ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Independent research culminating in a 30-page essay for the AMST senior requirement.
How to plan, research, and write an independent research project

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is a wholly independent course; there is not a regular seminar nor any explicit structure, so it's really important to meet with your advisor as regularly as possible throughout the process. My only complaint about the current setup is the final deadline -- I wish we had one more week to submit the final essay! (It's due the Sunday before the last week of classes, well before reading week starts, so it can be very stressful juggling this task with other final coursework as that deadline approaches.)

I wish there was a workshop early in the semester for students writing a one-semester thesis. I had very little understanding of structure and interim deadlines, and my advisor (who was not an AMST professor) wasn't the right person to go to with those questions.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments:
Really depends on your own situation -- if you need a more structured senior project, take 493/494 for the intensive major, since it comes with a senior seminar (however be aware that you won't be able to complete the intensive major if you can't make the seminar time both semesters). 
You also have the option of doing 491/492 and completing a creative project through independent study, so you *can* do a yearlong thesis without the requirements of the intensive major, but it just works a little differently. I highly recommend doing independent research regardless -- the senior seminars are great, but you'll get so much more out of this opportunity if you work independently.

Yes! I am super happy that I did a thesis, and that I did it in one semester. It definitely satisfied my interest in doing a research project of my own choosing, in a lot of depth, without the stress of a yearlong project. I think especially if you're AMST and looking to write a traditional paper, this is a perfect timeline to create something.
